p: Protection after secondary infection also presents some differences compared to protective response following primary infection. Following secondary infection levels of induced antibodies are higher, with a broader specificity and higher affinity. Their cross-protective activity can persist for a longer period of time after secondary infection, with sustained T and B cell memory. There is consensus in the field that post-secondary infections (i.e., third or fourth infections) are mostly asymptomatic (for a review see [ 23]).
